p: The dominant herbaceous plants had an intermediate abundance and coefficient of variation, skewness, and kurtosis ( Table 2). The plant distribution characteristics of herbs were between those of R. chrysanthum and V. uliginosum, and the statistical characteristics of the six herb species varied with species. The abundance of S. parviflora was the highest among the six herb species, and its coefficient of variation, skewness, and kurtosis were the lowest ( Table 2). L. jamesii had an intermediate abundance but the highest coefficients of variation, skewness, and kurtosis are among the six herbs ( Table 2).
